meanings.definition: A rough version of a film before the final editing process.
meanings.sent1: The director reviewed the workprints to decide which scenes needed improvement.
meanings.sent2: The editor compared the workprints to the final cut to see the changes made.
meanings.sent3: The workprints were so messy that the editor couldn't make heads or tails of them!
meanings.sent4: The workprints were like rough sketches, capturing the essence of the film.
meanings.sent5: The workprints revealed the raw emotions of the actors, unpolished and real.

meanings.definition: To create a rough version of a film for editing purposes.
meanings.sent1: The filmmaker decided to workprints the movie before the final editing stage.
meanings.sent2: She carefully workprints each scene to ensure a smooth editing process later.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally workprints the wrong footage, causing confusion in the editing room.
meanings.sent4: The director workprints the film like a sculptor shaping a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Working on the workprints allows the filmmaker to refine the story before finalizing it.
